com.polytech.di4.HelloAnt

Class AntMapTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.polytech.di4.HelloAnt.AntMapTemplate

  • public class AntMapTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
    The AntMapTemplate class represents a template of an ant game map. It's responsible for holding map data like interactive game objects and cell type in memory. The content of this class is not supposed to be modified during runtime. The class may be accessed in the following cases : - creation of a new game based on the number of required bots. - initiation of a game (setup game objects, spawns, etc...) The class also interfaces with map files (loading/saving).
    Author:
    Nicolas
    See Also:
    Documentation/specifications/mapformat.html

      • botCount

        private int botCount
        The number of bots the map is designed for. The game manager is supposed to supply this exact amount of bots to use this map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AntMapTemplate

        public AntMapTemplate()
        Creates a new ant map template. There is no parameter for this constructor because the map template is supposed to be loaded from a external file or generated internally.

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public void generate(int botCount,
                     int cols,
                     int rows)
        Generates a map template.
        Parameters:
        botCount - the number of bots the map is designed for.
        cols - the desired number of columns.
        rows - the desired number of rows.

      • loadFromFile

        public void loadFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         InvalidMapFormatException
        Loads an ant map from a file. All the map parameters previously present in the structure will be replaced if the parsing is successful.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the map file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        InvalidMapFormatException
        See Also:
        Documentation/specifications/mapformat.html

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Saves the ant map to a text file with respect to the map format conventions. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten. This method is provided to be used jointly to the map generation.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the map file.
        See Also:
        Documentation/specifications/mapformat.html

      • toJSON

        public org.json.JSONObject toJSON()
        Exports the map as a JSON object containing the map data. This method is used to generate the content of the "map" attribute of the replay format of an ant game.
        Returns:
        the JSONObject representing the map.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/replayformat.html

      • _toStringArray

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.StringBuilder> _toStringArray()
        Gets the string array representation of the map. This method is used to generate the map rows as string for other export methods. We use StringBuilder objects to simplify string the cooking of the strings.
        Returns:
        a list of strings representing the rows of the map.

      • getBotCount

        public int getBotCount()
        Gets the number of bots the map is designed for.
        Returns:
        the number of concurrent bots the map accepts.

      • getCols

        public int getCols()
        Gets the total number of columns of the map.
        Returns:
        the column count for this map.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Gets the total number of rows of the map.
        Returns:
        the row count for this map.
